1.q_string: Find the work done by a force given (in N) by F<sub>x</sub> = (5x - 4) when this force acts on a particle that moves from x = 1 m to x = 3 m.

A crane is used to lift 10000 kg of coal from a mine 100 m deep. If the time taken to lift coal by the crane is 1 hour, then what is the power of the driving mechanism of the crane?
(Efficiency of the crane is 80%, g = 9.8 m/s2)

A particle of mass m has half the kinetic energy of another particle of mass m/2. If the speed of the heavier particle is increased by 2 ms<sup>-1</sup>, then its new kinetic energy equals the original kinetic energy of the lighter particle. What is the original speed of the heavier particle?
The momentum of a body increases by 20%. What is the percentage increase in its kinetic energy?

Two identical cylindrical vessels, with their bases at the same level, contain a liquid of density . The height of the liquid in one vessel is h1 and that in the other is h2. The area of either base is A. What is the work done by gravity in equalising the levels when the vessels are interconnected?

The potential energy (in joule) of a body of mass 2 kg moving in the xy plane is given by U = 6x + 8y, where the position coordinates x and y are measured in metres. If the body is at rest at point (6 m, 4 m) at time t = 0, then it will cross the y-axis at time t equal to

A particle, which is constrained to move along the x-axis, is subjected to a force in the same direction, which varies with the distance x of the particle from the origin as F(x) = – kx + ax3. Here, k and a are positive constants. For x  0, the functional form of the potential energy U(x) of the particle is

A uniform rope of length L is lying in a lump on a frictionless table. A small part of the rope is held hanging through a hole in the table just below the lump. The system is then released. The speed of the end of the rope, as it leaves the hole, is

Suppose the box springs back off of the spring with no loss of energy, after sliding on the frictionless surface, it encounters another level surface with a coefficient of friction of 0.200. How far does the box slide on this surface before coming to rest?
A pendulum has a length l. Its bob is pulled aside from its equilibrium position through an angle θ and then released. The speed of the bob when it passes through the equilibrium position is given by

q_option: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true and Statement - 2 is the correct explanation of Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true, but Statement - 2 is not the correct explanation of Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is false.
Statement - 1 is false, Statement - 2 is true.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement - 1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement - 2 (Reason). The question consists of the following four choices, out of which only one choice is correct.

Statement - 1:

A simple pendulum of length I is displaced from its mean position O to position A such that the string makes an angle θ1with the vertical and is then released. If air resistance is neglected, then the speed of the bob, when the string makes an angle θ2 with the vertical, is v =\(\sqrt{2 g l\left(\cos \theta_{2}-\cos \theta_{1}\right)}\)

Statement - 2:

The total momentum of a system is conserved if no external force acts on it.

A mass m is attached to the end of a rod of length l. The mass goes around a vertical circular path with the other end hinged at the centre. What should be the minimum velocity of mass at the bottom of the circle, so that the mass completes the circle?

The figure shows a smooth curved track terminating in a smooth horizontal part. A spring of spring constant 400 N/m is attached at one end to the wedge fixed rigidly with the horizontal part. A 40 g mass is released from a position of rest at a height of 4.9 m on the curved track. What is the maximum compression of the spring?
(Take g = 9.8 m/s2)

q_option: Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true and Statement - 2 is the correct explanation of Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true, Statement - 2 is true, but Statement - 2 is not the correct explanation of Statement - 1.
Statement - 1 is true; Statement - 2 is false.
Statement - 1 is false; Statement - 2 is true.
1.q_string:
Directions: In the following question, Statement-1 (Assertion) is followed by Statement-2 (Reason). The question consists of the following four choices out of which only one choice is correct.

Statement - 1: Two inclined frictionless tracks of different inclinations θ1 and θ2 meet at A from where two blocks P and Q of different masses m1 and m2 are allowed to slide down from rest, one on each track as shown in the figure. Then, blocks P and Q will reach the bottom with the same speed.

Statement - 2: Blocks P and Q have equal accelerations down their respective tracks.

An electric pump is used to fill an overhead tank of capacity 9 m<sup>3</sup> kept at a height of 10 m above the ground. If the pump takes 5 minutes to fill the tank by consuming 10 kW power, then the efficiency of the pump must be (take g = 10 ms<sup>-2</sup>)
